I joined Steam quite a while back now, after Microsoft ditched MS-FSX and the sim was left to fester, Steam acquired a licence to let them update the game and move it to their platform so I joined steam to support this effort by Steam, however, whilst playing the much improved MS FSX I fell amongst bad influences and bought Sniper Elite 4, and loved it, I have since bought other titles too and like the idea of not having disks to scratch or keys to worry about as steam looks after it all for me.
I play Sniper Elite 4 far too much, but then, who doesn't once they find it! It is a well established game, slick and bug free, but not for smaller kids I suppose. If you find the price too high, just wait like I did for a bundle sale to come round like I did, because it came with all the DLC as well for less than the base cost of the game!
Already looking forward to Sniper Elite 5, I wait to see how they can improve on an already great Game, with Slick and smooth play.

UPDATE.
Sniper Elite III and 4 are just as good as ever, as for Sniper Elite 5, the long awaited update, FORGET IT NOW and stick with III & 4.
5 is buggy, very expensive, even in the current summer sale and it's all messed up.
Why do I say it''s messed up, EASY:
The game is called "SNIPER ELITE", simple clue to the idea and game-play.
Well Sniper Elite 5 is no longer focused on the sniper element and as such, it no longer has the right to be called Sniper Elite 5 in my opinion.
Virtually nothing to do with sniping, in and out, causing as much damage as you can.

Stick with what you have, or buy versions III and 4.

I liked Sniper Elite 2, but it's not Steam Deck compatible, so when the Summer Sale hit, I picked up Sniper Elite 4.  I am enjoying skulking around killing Nazis/Blackshirts (This one is set in Italy so far), destroying military equipment, etc. I have had ZERO issues running the game on my Steam Deck, even when connected to a dock and a 1440p monitor.  The game art is excellent, and the only quibble I would make is that it doesn't recognize my Sony DualShock controller and use the Sony buttons on screen.  The controller itself works perfectly, even rumble, but the game uses ABXY buttons, which is a touch aggravating at times.

1.) Fun to play through the campaign at least one time.
2.) The combat can be fun at times, however the 3PP pov is extremely offputting.
3.) The game looks fairly decent and runs well also, maybe just needs a little further optimization.
4.) IF you're a fan of the Sniper Elite series, then this is for sure a solid pick up when on a deep sale.
5.) If you've never played any of the 'Sniper Elite' series, I would recommend started with this one, I believe.
6.) The slow motion camera of headshots and body part shots are some of the most fun to be had in this game.
7.) The overall replay-ability of the game feels relatively shallow, more of a one time through type of deal.

Sniper 4 delivers an outstanding sniper experience that's packed with precision and exhilaration. The game's attention to detail in sniping mechanics is unmatched, offering an immersive and authentic feel. The stunning visuals, realistic environments, and atmospheric effects create a truly immersive world. With a captivating single-player campaign and cooperative multiplayer mode, Sniper 4 provides hours of intense and strategic gameplay. Quite a fun game! Very much like Hitman, it releases the player into a large sandbox with a gun and a strong recommendation to keep things stealthy. Anyways, I began by ignoring the game's advice and very quickly went all guns blazing. The game is very polished, the x-ray killcam really makes it feel like the shot has impact and the difficulty is massively customisable. I know very few other games that make long-range murder this much fun. Now, that's a sentence I didn't think I'd say today...

main game: i played the entire main campaign in authentic plus difficulty with my good friend Mr. Thraex. We like a challenge and i feel like you need to experience the harder difficulty in this game. It gives the experience of a real sniper. If you get spotted in easy difficulty you can just run and gun but in the harder difficulty you have to sneak and play tactically. Overall the main campaign was really enjoyable. there are not many sniping games that do it as good as sniper elite.

target fuhrer DLC: It is a cool DLC with multiple unique option to kill hitler. however It is only 1 extra mission and you should decide whether or not 1 mission is worth the cost for you. For me it was because i bought it in sale (like i always do) and i like getting every achievement in games.

deathstorm part 1, 2 and 3: like the target fuhrer DLC these 3 DLC's give you 1 extra mission per DLC (so 3 total) every single mission is very different from each other. so again. If you like extra missions with extra collectibles and challenges you might like these too.

overwatch: Me and Mr. Thraex tried to complete these challenges in authentic plus as well. however this game mode is not meant to be played in a high difficulty since you can't tag enemies (which is very important in this game mode because there is 1 sniper and 1 spotter). so we finished it in a lower difficulty (sniper elite). the missions are fun for just 1 time.

multiplayer: The multiplayer is pretty boring in this game. sniper vs sniper just doesn't work in a PVP. i only played every game mode once (for achievement) and was very bored the entire time. I must say the community that plays the multiplayer are very nice people.I had some nice chats.
Really fun game overall, in fact the entire series is fun. It gets repetitive if you play 2 SE games back to back, but the hitman-esque gameplay loop is quite good

Title: Sniper Elite 4 - An Exhilarating and Graphically Impressive Game

Rating: 4/5

Sniper Elite 4 is a thrilling and visually impressive game that offers a unique and engaging sniping experience. With its realistic ballistics and graphic representation, this installment in the Sniper Elite series delivers an exciting gameplay that will keep players on the edge of their seats.

One of the standout features of Sniper Elite 4 is its fun and satisfying gameplay mechanics. As a sniper, you'll need to carefully plan your approach, analyze your surroundings, and execute precise shots to take down enemies. The game provides a range of tools and weapons to assist you in accomplishing your objectives, and the satisfaction of pulling off a well-planned shot is unmatched. The slow-motion bullet cam, which shows the bullet's trajectory in detail, adds an extra layer of excitement and gratification to each successful hit.

The game's graphics are truly exceptional. The environments are beautifully rendered, whether it's the sun-drenched landscapes of Italy or the war-torn streets of a city. The attention to detail is impressive, with intricate textures, realistic lighting, and stunning atmospheric effects. The game's visuals contribute to the immersive experience, making you feel like you're in the midst of a World War II battleground.

Sniper Elite 4 also offers a variety of missions and objectives to keep you engaged throughout the game. From sabotaging enemy equipment to rescuing hostages, each mission presents unique challenges and opportunities. The open-world design provides a sense of freedom, allowing players to approach objectives in different ways and encouraging strategic thinking.

In terms of criticisms, Sniper Elite 4 does have a few minor drawbacks. While the gameplay is undoubtedly enjoyable, some players may find the pacing a bit slow at times, especially during moments of exploration. Additionally, the story, while serviceable, may not be the main highlight of the game. However, these minor issues do not detract significantly from the overall experience.

Overall, Sniper Elite 4 is an incredibly fun and visually stunning game that offers an immersive sniping experience. Its engaging gameplay, combined with exceptional graphics, ensures an adrenaline-fueled journey through World War II. With its few minor flaws aside, Sniper Elite 4 is a highly recommended title for fans of the genre, earning a solid rating of 4 out of 5.

I haven't played this game very much, so take my review with a grain of salt. I tried to like it and I just couldn't.

The characters are aesthetically inert Hollywood cookie-cutters, and the tensionless stories they take part in aren't any better. World War II is one of the most interesting periods in human history, and the writers couldn't get past old action movie tropes that were worn out the second time they were used. A boring story doesn't always ruin a game for me, but Sniper Elite 4's was just endlessly grating. Combine that with the ugly visual stylization, complete lack of immersion, confusingly prevalent microtransactions, and busywork that's transparently padding, and the adjective 'bland' is too high a compliment.

Maybe you can't get a good sense of how a game really plays after 3.5 hours, but my experience so far was pretty bad. Stealth with guns can, I suppose, be a good combination, but I couldn't ever figure out how to avoid things devolving into a boring third-person cover shooter. The sniping mechanics were also bewildering. Waiting for noise cover is annoying, and clicking helmets when their owners decide to pop up is simply not engaging.

I can see this game being fun in co-op, where you can more easily lean into the goofiness (judging from my experience with Aragami 2). Additionally, the VR Sniper Elite game is a contender for the best game I've played in a headset. You can find good experiences that are adjacent to this, but Sniper Elite 4 in single player is kind of atrocious, not even worth the five or six bucks I paid for it.

Ballistics are fun, core gameplay overall is just solid. All the rifles work well, and none felt underpowered. Shotguns kinda suck tho.

Stealth is really fun to pull off, but once someone raises the alarm they will NEVER go back to casual routines, staying at low alert, so be careful.

Autosave is fair (usually) and works well (usually).

When comparing Sniper Elite 4 to its successor, Sniper Elite 5, it's clear that Sniper Elite 4 offers a superior and more satisfying gaming experience. Despite Sniper Elite 5's visual appeal and intriguing invasion mode, Sniper Elite 4 stands out in several significant ways:
Sniper Elite 4 delivers a captivating gameplay experience that keeps players hooked from start to finish. The game strikes a perfect balance between stealth, strategy, and intense action, making each mission a thrilling adventure. Additionally, the game's graphics are nothing short of breathtaking. The attention to detail in the environments, character models, and weapon designs creates a visually stunning world that truly immerses players in the game.
Sniper Elite 4 boasts a vast array of missions, challenges, and game modes that provide endless hours of gameplay. The game offers a rich and immersive campaign, as well as additional modes such as co-op main campaign and survival as well as ‚Äúoverwatch‚Äù, which further extend the game's longevity. With each playthrough, players discover new tactics, ensuring that Sniper Elite 4 remains engaging and enjoyable even after multiple playthroughs.
In conclusion, whether you're a fan of the series or new to the franchise, Sniper Elite 4 is a must-play that guarantees hours of thrilling sniper action and an overall satisfying gaming experience.

I've played Sniper Elite 3 and I can say this-Sniper Elite 4 is much better and improves on its predecessor.

Let's get some minor gripes out of the way. Like in SE3, there are generators that you can interact with that make noise. However, unlike SE3 which I found to be hard to find, the ones in SE4 are placed awkwardly and badly on some maps IMO. Let's say there's a place where enemies are congregated such as a building or something that I wanna snipe stealthily at. Rather than place the generator in a safe place 150-200m away, it would often be AT the place that I'm targetting. I once cleared a castle-like building in one map to find a generator in it and thought "Really, I could've used this somewhere else". Some are placed in vantageless points where you can't pick enemy soldiers off lest even see them on your binoculars.

Okay now that we got those minor gripes out of the way, this game felt much better to play than SE3. The maps and environment feel much better and more immersive. I'd spend several hours picking off enemies and completing everything a level had to offer. Even though it's probably been at least a year since I've played SE3, it felt like I improved as a player in SE4 which I don't know if that's true or if that's because the game feels much "smoother" and intuitive. 

I'll be honest, $60 is a little expensive considering this is a game from 2017 and SE5 is out. However, I bought the game on sale for $5 and can definitely say it's been worth it. Have fun killing Nazis and foiling their plans while you see the iconic X-Ray animations.

Sniper Elite 4 lets you assume the role of a wooden American sniper fighting against Italian fascists and German nazis in Italy during ww2. 

pros
++ gunplay: check out the different difficulty settings. while lower difficulties shoot where you are aiming at, higher difficulties change the bullet trajectory
++ great maps: never before in the Sniper Elite series have the maps been bigger, more open and offered more verticality and more pathways for various strategies
+ coop campaign
+ graphics
+ performance
+ shoot during loud sounds or use surpressed ammo to take out a bunch of bad guys
+ DLCs: I enjoyed killing Hitler and finishing the 3 DLC missions

neutral
+/- the story and the characters could be more polished
+/- controls require some fiddling to avoid accidental vaulting among other things

cons
- no nazi iconography and not enough blood & gore
- no FOV slider
- the AI is braindead at times, doesn't do enough to find you and calls off searches early

This sniper elite was incredible. The DLC even was incredible. When you were a kid remember when you loved a game so much and then got dlc? Remember how awesome it was that your favorite game could keep being played? This is that. Basically the base game is incredible and has more guns than you will ever need. (I like that) the guns aren't outlandish either they are 95% guns you'd see on the western front or south front in ww2. No gun is perfect and each is suited to better needs of the player. The Germans are well textured. The game pretends to have a story but it's one of the first times you actually gave a damn about the friendly NPCs. But back to the DLC comment, the DLC itself is so damn good they are fully made from scratch maps. They also have entirely new enemies. Italian paratroopers or mountain troops, kriegsmarines, and green devil fallschirmjagers. It's worth it. 5 is a complete walk back.

This is a decent sniper that spans 8 missions. There are wind, bullet drop and distance mechanics but I did find myself relying on the aim assist mode quite a lot (Hold down space bar and it will show you on screen where the bullet will land so you don't have to figure it out for yourself)

For a sniper game I found there to be a surprising lack of nice overlook positions (A lot of times you're shooting straight across or even shooting upwards, as opposed to looking over a valley. Many times a giant mountain or something will be in your way) and a surprising abundance of objectives that require you to go to indoor settings where you have no choice but to fight close quarters. Call me naive but I didn't expect half of a sniper game to take place inside bunkers. So that was annoying; as opposed to the soundmask system (You'll have barely any silenced ammo in this game, meaning if you don't use soundmask areas the whole map will come running to you) which is a fun challenge to work around.

I was unable to really play the Multiplayer so basically forget about it. I didn't have a mate to do the Co-op with but I imagine it would be fun. And the Survival mode is hard and to be honest kind of confused me with what I was meant to do, as it seemed really easy for the enemy to step foot into a zone you're meant to protect and you fail the game, there's just so many enemies in so many areas.

I also grabbed Target Fuhrer DLC while it was on discount and it was worth it for $3, basically a full mission though with less of the story stuff and fluff. Plus the memes.

It's only a 2017 game so all the graphics and handling hold up well, that's no issue.
The soundtrack is unremarkable but hey, not all games can be composed by Jesper Kyd.

Would give a [b]6.9/10[/b], definitely not buy at full price for me. Hopefully SE5 is better

This is my first game in the series and I definitely enjoyed it and would recommend it. Simply put the game feels very refined with all the gameplay features implemented well. Playing SE 3 after playing this one felt like a significant step down because of all the improvements 4 had. The only real gripes I had with the game are that the story is pretty boring and uninteresting, and that traversal could get annoying as well with no real ability to jump except at specific places. 

Heres a breakdown of the general positives and negatives that I felt playing the game:

+ AI detection and alertness is improved over SE 3
+ Suppressed ammo and sound masking makes stealth fighting better
+ Fun maps to fight in with a lot of different paths and options for downing enemies
+ Weapon choices are good

-/+ Killing Hitler DLC is fun but not as good as in 3, other DLCs ok

- Half-singleplayer/ half-multiplayer achievements 
- Story is bland
- Traversal can be weird

Sniper Elite 4 is a great stealth game. For someone that enjoys franchises like Metal Gear I felt welcomed. The World War Two setting in Italy is great and often overlooked in most games. Its fun to fight the italians for once in a game.

The long rifle shooting is phenomenal, with wind, sound and bullet drop dynamics, makes me wish non sniper games also develop similar mechanics.

You are given several secondary tools to complete your objectives and make traps, it certainly gives a deeper layer of strategy and enchances ambushes as well as creating diversions for relocationg yourself to another sniper nest.

Oh the story is cool also, ww2 single player games are rare these days so I'm not very demanding on story telling, the twist in the end was fun but not very logical in my opinion.

Sniper Elite 4 is an incredibly enjoyable and immersive tactical shooter game that is sure to satisfy fans of the genre. From the moment I started playing, I was immediately drawn in by the game's stunning graphics and well-designed environments.

The game's main character, Karl Fairburne, is a skilled marksman with a wide variety of weapons and gadgets at his disposal, and the game's mechanics are designed in such a way that players are encouraged to take a stealthy, tactical approach to each mission.

One of the game's standout features is its use of realistic ballistics and physics, which adds a level of realism to the game that is rare in the shooter genre. Players must take into account factors such as bullet drop, wind resistance, and even the rotation of the earth when making their shots.

The game's AI is also well-designed, with enemies that react realistically to the player's actions and can even communicate with each other to coordinate attacks. This adds an extra layer of challenge to the game and makes each mission feel like a real test of skill.

Overall, I would highly recommend Sniper Elite 4 to anyone looking for a fun and challenging tactical shooter game. It's a game that rewards players who are willing to take their time and think strategically, and the attention to detail in the game's mechanics and graphics is truly impressive. I would rate the game an 8.5/10.

Is this game fun? Yes. Are the ballistic physics accurate? No, absolutely not. rifles that should have a muzzle velocity of 2900 fps are only about 700 in game. Bullet drop is insane, for example if you are set to 0m and your target is at 50m if you aim at his head you will hit a lung. Thats like an 8-10" drop in just 50m. smgs are basically useless unless you are within knife distance. However If you can get over the fact that you are armed with pellet rifles and rng bullet hoses its pretty satisfying to bust Nazi skulls. For the most realistic shooting feel turn off bullet drop and turn up all other modifiers to hard.

Its an alright game. I enjoyed killing men, who could have been my great grandfathers. Variation in the missions, not even once the same thing to do (except blowing up some canons) and some very different maps, made the game pretty nice. 
Also the kill-animations are quite cool and if you dont wanna see them you can just skip. 
But there are 3 things where I have to say, they really bothered me. First you can start and finish the game with the same weapons. What I mean by that is simply the fact, that you never need anything special and you already have kind of like the best weapons at the begining (except you by a dlc with silenced weapons). So it was never worth to by new weapons because they either had more bullets, but way less damage or they where almost the same as the start weapons. Second thing was that you arent abled to upgrade your weapons in any way, like silencer or better zoom or anything. The third thing, what really pissed me of was, when I pressed alt+tab to switch to something else on my second screen, I wasnt able to get into the game again. Idk it was propably a problem on my site, but I had to restart the game completly. Luckely it has a very  good autosave that saved most of the stuff i did already. Still a good game but maybe wait for a discount because 60‚Ç¨ is still quite much even of that game.

"Sniper Elite 4" is a tactical shooter developed and published by Rebellion Developments. It is the fourth installment in the "Sniper Elite" series and was released in 2017.

Gameplay:

"Sniper Elite 4" is a third-person tactical shooter that emphasizes stealth and precision shooting. Players take on the role of Karl Fairburne, a sniper and special operations agent who is tasked with helping the Italian resistance fight against the Nazis during World War II. The game features large, open-ended levels that offer a variety of ways to complete objectives, allowing players to choose between stealth, sniping, or a more action-oriented approach. The game's mechanics, such as bullet ballistics and wind direction, add an extra layer of realism to the sniping experience.

Graphics:

"Sniper Elite 4" features impressive graphics, with highly detailed environments and character models. The game's large levels are filled with a variety of locations, from small villages to sprawling military bases. The game's use of light and shadow also adds to the game's atmosphere, making it feel like a true stealth experience.

Soundtrack:

The game's soundtrack is serviceable but not particularly memorable. However, the game's sound design is impressive, with the sound of gunfire and explosions adding to the immersion of the gameplay.

Reception:

"Sniper Elite 4" has received generally positive reviews from critics and players, who have praised the game's large, open-ended levels and satisfying sniping mechanics. The game's AI has also been praised for being challenging and unpredictable, adding to the game's replayability. Some players have criticized the game's lack of innovation, however, stating that it doesn't do much to differentiate itself from previous entries in the series.

Conclusion:

"Sniper Elite 4" is a solid addition to the "Sniper Elite" series, offering large, open-ended levels and satisfying sniping mechanics. While the game may not offer anything particularly new, it is a well-executed game that is sure to appeal to fans of the series and to players who enjoy tactical shooters. The game's realistic mechanics and attention to detail make it a standout title in the genre. If you're a fan of sniping or tactical shooters, "Sniper Elite 4" is definitely worth checking out.

This is a very good sniper elite episode. It improves and fixes almost all the points of Elite 3.

The graphics and animations are really good, even by today‚Äôs standards.

Level design is excellent: Levels are huge, they fell real and natural (not artificial like in most games). There is also like million ways to go though and ‚Äúsolve‚Äù each level (as compared to two to three ways for the previous episode)

Audio is both good and bad: Music and sound effects are good. However, there is a gameplay issue with them: ambient music contains explosion sounds which can be misleading concerning what is happening. Also, the 3D sound engine is really bad: in DX12, it simply does not work for some reason, important NPC sound effects are all coming from the same direction (such as voices and foot steps). In DX11, the 3D is working, but some effects are still way too hard to localize. This is one of the biggest issues which is ‚Äúinfiltration‚Äù game.

The most important problem comes from the NPCs which are both too competent and stupid at the same time. When you set the difficulty to the max, they are almost bullet sponges, they react too quickly, and aim too well. This is neither realistic nor immersive. On the other hand, even if everybody knows you are killing them at in the same choke point, they continue to come in your trap blindly...

All in all, I played the game at the max difficulty level, but with AI set to max-1. That gave me a good immersive and ‚Äúrealistic‚Äù game.

Plus, you can play the campaign in coop, personalize your weapons, and your loadout!
Definitely worth a buy, even at full price.

Another brilliant entry for the Sniper Elite franchise with its signature X-Ray Vision Kill Cam is definitely among some of the best sniper themed games out there. Basically there are different maps in the game where each main mission (Campaign) would take place, a few side objectives here and there, multiple creative ways to assassinate your target.

The story line itself is pretty average in my opinion, but I wasn't here for its story, so no big deal for me. This game also offers several difficulties, ranging from casual sniping to hardcore sniping (no HUD I think, not sure, I played on Normal Sniper Elite difficulty).

I also recommend getting the DLCs as they include some other interesting missions aside from the main campaign story line.

Ahhhh....Sniper Elite 4......still in a class of its own. I pretty much dislike every other 3 person shooter ever made but not this one. This one is a gem for me.   I have been playing this one particular for I dont know how many years (5 years at least I think)  on PS2 and PC.  I could not tell you how many dozens if not hundreds of times I have played the same missions over and over and over and I still want to replay them.   Once you figure out the enemy and game AI it becomes almost easy but you still need to plan your progress through the missions. Best advice watch some gameplay videos online and decide if you like the graphics, sound, style, etc.  It usually goes on sale for a pretty deep discount so wait for that if you are not sure and I would suggest getting the DLC maps as well.  Does require patience and stealth for some parts but other parts you can get CODish against the AI with a machine/submachine gun. I wish they would have made a dozen more maps for this version.  Sadly, there will probably never be another game like this one ever again.

I was playing the DLC mission where you assassinate Hitler. I tagged an infantryman and it said that he "unclogged the toilet block; was surprised to find a harmonica causing the blockage." 

Later on, I tag another soldier. It said that he "has lost his harmonica, thinks Lasch stole it." I tag the guy next to him and, lo and behold, he is "fed up with Ackner's harmonica-playing. Has taken appropriate measures to stop it."

Finally, about a minute later, after Hitler has left, a German man tells everyone over the intercom, "do not insert foreign objects into the latrine".

I could go on and on about the guns, the movement, the story, whatever, but the gag with the harmonica blocking the toilets in a German naval base off the coast of Greece is what really makes the game worth its pricetag.

[h1][Review #14]
Sniper Elite 4[/h1]
SE4 is a solid 3rd person shooter with both long and short range combat. The game is very fun to play with friends and can easily take around 2-3 hours to complete a mission, because of the sheer size of each map. Each map are also non-linear to allow for multiple ways to tackle your task. You are able to kill enemies through various ways, with the most prominent one being sniping them. There are a ton of collectibes in each mission as well, which can be missed on the first playthrough prompting you to replay the level.

As you shoot, slow-mo cam cuts in showing the bullet penetrating the enemy's body and destroying a certain organ or the skull depending on where you shoot. Other than sniping, there are multiple assault rifles and pistols and a shotgun to utilise. One of my favourite ways to kill enemies to booby trapping the enemy's body and luring their mates to come check it out, killing them with glorious slow mo cam. \

Overall, I really enjoyed this game, however there are a few shortcomings. There are some bugs, one of which involves an officer climbing up an invisible ladder seemingly towards the sky or fall through the ground and the sensitivity getting ridiculously low when you are running. Furthermore, the save system for this game is quite buggy. You can save and reload and bodies can either disappear or becomes unsearchable. Explosions are not realistic too as enemies can survive being near an explosion a few meters away and the characters always seem like it can't decide whether to go up or down the ladder which is infuriating.

As for multiplayer, it is present but forgettable and there are literally no one playing it so don't bother with it.

I will recommend buying it for the single player side of things only. Co-op is present. Servers are mostly stable, but sometime Steam disconnects itself which can cause partner to drop out, and when you are playing Authentic Plus with no manual saves this can be the last thing you wanna experience or you will have to restart the whole mission.

It's worth it in a sale if you are not expecting the most amazing story ever and just want to see some nazi brains deflate, eyes explode, lungs deflate as well as perform long distance castration and teeth surgery. It definitely provides that.

The story is campy but fun, but you probably don't really care that much, villains are comically evil even when you find their "letters to/from home" trying to sometimes humanize them or further vilify them, it suffers a bit from the whole collective galore issues in maps with all these extra little bits but they're not really affecting of gameplay in any way, just sorta works as painting a better picture of the world.

I played on the Sniper Eltie difficulty and yeah it wasn't really particularly difficult, it was hard to lead shots sometimes because the aiming indicator would get confused if the target you aimed at was obstructed by objects in front of it.

The game has no bullet penetration which can feel a little sad when trying to shoot a dude hiding behind a wooden crate but those are all just minor thing, and explosions have a really small AoE which can lead to some shots you expect to blow up several enemies with to only hit one guy or no one and so they felt pretty unsatisfying

I think the biggest negative I can think of is the sensitivity slider feeling absolutely awful on aimed guns that are not the sniper rifle

The leveling system was okay, gun customization felt pretty redundant as I just went for the rifle with the longest range and highest damage, nothing else really matters after that.

You unlock challenges to a map after completing it so if you want to go back and do those, I didn't bother, didn't really see a reason to, there's 8 campaign maps plus some DLC stuff, the maps are pretty large and offer a few different ways to approach it, but they were large enough that I didn't feel like playing through them again.

Sniper Elite 4 is the third Sniper Elite Game I have completed until now - and actually also the best of them.

The Areas inwhich the missions do take place are very large, which allows the player to complete the missions in various ways. In addition to that, several optional goals are within (nearly) each mission, which adds some more fun to them.

It took me 16hrs to complete all missions (with all optional mission goals), but it would still be possible to spend more time here in order to unlock/max out the weapons.

Overall I would recommend this SE game to everbody who had fun already with the previous parts.

Few things to add as an edit. Shooting range multiplayer would be awesome. Expanded Kill Cam menu to toggle which weapons and effects trigger and at what percentage not maybe at a higher chance. New Kill Cam weapons like the pistol, close range shots with the shotgun, add the ability to throw your knife and retrieve it for silent ranged kills at a very short distance to not make it too OP (smaller hit-box, null dmg if wrong area hit). Sniper Elite 4 is the best of the series so far.

Prior to this Sniper Elite V2 was my favorite, and this version is most comparable but with larger maps which isn't a bad thing. The only complaint I have about this game and all the games for that matter after V2 is there seems to be a consistent decline in environmental sound masking, which if you're trying to play stealth is pivotal to what you're doing here. I don't know if this is encouragement to purchase inherently suppressed weapons with real cash, or trying to force people to use suppressed ammo? I dunno, but that last bit is the kicker.

Suppressed ammo is an absolute godsend to use. There are sometimes instances, especially with the decline of environmental masking, where you absolutely need to take out a group of dudes quickly to maintain stealth. This is an exploration type game mixed in with a sniping game, and if you take your time and roam the maps you will absolutely find the suppressed ammo you need.

Kill cam is always great and improved as with every Sniper Elite game that comes out.

I know this game has been out for a while, but it's new to me, and I just absolutely love it. Always hated FPS's that are fast-paced, guns-a-blazin' style. I'm more partial to sneaking and being stealthy, and that's exactly what this is. You can definitely go at your own pace and make it fun, thinking of creative ways to take people out. Plenty of explosive barrels and stuff to work with, pulleys to shoot and create chain reactions, different types of mines, all that fun stuff. 
I gotta commend the graphics, they are some of the best I've ever encountered, as far as how high you can crank the settings vs. how hard it works my pc (probably since it's capped at 60 fps). I'm running a 3060 and have the graphics turned all the way up, card never gets over 60 degrees C. 
I have two small complaints, neither of which are that big of a deal. 
1, there's no jumping. If you come up to something to climb or crawl over, there'll be a prompt that appears and let you up by pressing A, but to just jump, non-existent. 
2, the autosave feature is kind of annoying. It autosaves probably every minute, and that's your checkpoint for when you get deaded. Which means sometimes it'll sometimes autosave the moment after you make a terrible decision, and you'll just be stuck in the hole you dug for yourself, and sometimes the only way out of it is to restart the mission entirely, which is disheveling after you're 3-4 hours into said mission. But, if you're mindful, just wait in your hiding spot until you see the little autosave swirlybob, THEN make a move in case something goes wrong. Still wish there was an option to manually save though.
All in all, I love it and haven't put it down in the first week or two of owning it.

All of the Sniper Elite titles are pretty great but this one is big step ahead. The maps are excellent with what I consider to be excellent enemy placement and the shooting is varied in complexity and depth dependent on difficulty which offers a strong replay value component, but absolutely the best aspect of this title imho is the coop. It works excellently and the aspects of shared progress is worked out as I would prefer. It encourages play with both seasoned and amateur friends as u can work on many different aspects of achievements or missions simultaneously. Its now a favorite title of mine. PS - Excellent audio as well.

If you like hardcore modes and extreme challenges this is one of those games, if you want a bit better casual yet still challenging sniper game SE5 is the ticket. im pushing the authentic plus challenges achievement where you arent allowed to save, enemies are super alert and will teabag you if you are caught sleeping, the last mission i did took nearly 3 hours and it was gruelling with a dozen near death experiences that prompted me to start setting traps at every entry point so i wasnt hit with surprise buttseks, and no you dont hear them coming every time the little ninja bastards.
I resorted to luring them into exploding barrels and such and its satisfying to see 3-5 dudes blown up.
You also get to shoot hitlers testicles and watch them pop in x-ray slo-mo so theres that(hitler with a dlc).
A good feature you might enjoy is the x-ray bullet hits, slows down and you see it go through eyes, skulls, livers, intestines, kidneys, lungs, testicles and hearts. Not much more satisfying pinging a snipers eye through his scope at 300m.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

It is all fun and games...
Until you run across the GENERATOR BUG - which ruins one of the core mechanics.
The GENERATOR BUG will ruin your stealth kill streak / planning, and will FORCE you to fight without stealth.

When you come across this bug, the only way to continue playing stealth is to RESTART the mission - and this is devastating if you invested a lot of time playing the mission.

Can't believe that this bug haven't been fixed for years.

... Was what I thought at the beginning.
Now I recommend the game, even with it's bugs and all.
The sniping is flawless, and you can ignore the bug by destroying the Generators with each use. Sound masking using other environmental sources is also an alternative.

First things first: If you're not obsessed with WWII, a gun-nut or interested in snipers, you'll have a hard time loving this game. Especially if you keep in mind the many faults it has (pertaining to hist. acc., gameplay, general plausibility, and physics).

That said, this is a vast and solid improvement to the absolute GARBAGE that preceeded this - The story is a lot more fleshed out, characters are actually believable, someone apart from Americans gets to have agency, motivation, and conflicts. Even touches on politics from time to time, and a big plus is the Axis cooperation shown. Italians aren't just pawns and lackeys of the Germans in this game.

How they could bypass the chance to kill Mussolini in a DLC is beyond me, and a great fault of this game. Why do I want to kill H1tl3r again? In Italy?

If you enjoy Italian landscapes, the game presents lush and endearing sceneries. I guess that's a plus.

[i]Sniper Elite 4[/i] offers significantly more freedom in gameplay compared to previous [i]Sniper Elite[/i] games. Each level is an open area that invites exploration and experimentation. The game won't feel repetitive unless you play it in a monotonous manner. In fact, it packs a lot of variety into its campaign levels, both in terms of aesthetics and gameplay options. You have a wide range of tools at your disposal to take down enemies, including not just sniper rifles but also grenades, bombs, and more. I highly recommend using all of these resources to fully embrace the sandbox-like gameplay that [i]Sniper Elite 4[/i] encourages.

While there is nothing wrong with this game per se, there is little right with it, either. I played Sniper Elite 3 and liked the missions, the X-ray shots, the environments, etc. SE4 seems very much like a retread, but with more fussy controls. Sniper Elite seems to be one of those games series where once you've played one game, then you've really seen it all. Even the X-ray shots felt a little stale, as did the set-piece sniper shots. 

If you are new to the series, by all means play Sniper Elite 3 first. If you already have, then this one will seem very derivative. Sadly, I was bored before the end of the first mission.

Though I have yet to play the 5th game, I imagine that the fact that the previous game (this one) is priced higher than the newest game in the series is telling...

This game can offer plenty of fun and offers tons of ways you can customize your play experience. Do you want to play a casual shooter where you just point and click? You can do that. Do you want a more realistic hardcore sniping experience with bullet drop and wind mechanics? You can do that. Do you want to go full stealth with a silenced pistol, getting up close and personal for silent takedowns? You can do that. Or do you wanna run through it at full speed, making snap shots with your rifle, smg or pistol and being as loud and fast as you can? You can do that too.

This game, is as hard or easy as you want to make it. Going for challenges doesn't even need to be much of a chore, and with multiplayer coop, it is a hilarious and amusing game to break.

I will say the AI is uh... dumb as a brick sometimes. I mean when I stand up to knife someone from a bush, while their buddy is right next to them, they take an eternity to realize that yes, that walking bush (Ghille Commando <3) did just stab someone in gut a couple times, before walking over to where I am, entering said shrubbery and getting the same treatment... then I think there's a problem with the AI, though that might boil down to difficulty.

That being said, I would still try to pick this game up on sale if you can. So you can get it and all the DLC. I can't accept each individual mission being sold for 8$ (Canadian) or 10$ for the mission to kill Hitler but they are missions that you will not want to miss out on. Despite there only being 8 missions in the base game, they are highly replayable. So the extra four from DLC will go a long way if you can get them at a discount.

My experience with this game can be resumed in:


- Sitting inside a bush, tossing pebbles and picking soldiers off with a silenced gun (cos they WILL always find you if you use your loud as ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• rifle)

- Soldiers going way WAY out of their way to find corpses I took 20 minutes of my life hiding away (I'm surprised they don't jump in the water just to see the corpses)

- Sound masking is a pain to play with, whenever there is a sound-masking thing going off every few seconds you can be sure any targets will be well hidden when it goes off, and when it fades away everyone will be back in the open.

- Stealth kills (when you get up close and personal) are unreliable because the AI have the annoying tendency to turn around instantly spotting you and instantly alerting everyone on the map of where you are.

- Enemy snipers are omniscient.

Single player is around 25 hours of game play, didn't purchase DLC's. Game felt unfinished, dragged at the beginning and ended fast. First time purchasing a Sniper franchise game so not sure if there are others but I would only recommend purchasing on sale, multiplayer is good for a few hours of play. I found myself preferring FPS in this game, doesn't feel like a sniper game, would be interested to see what this franchise could do with modern weapons like drones and modern gear. Level design was all over the place, engineering wise it made me laugh lol.. not sure devs understand the physics of structural buildings. I started reading the letters and intel you acquire during the game, around the middle of the game I couldn't do it anymore.. do you kiss your mothers with that mouth devs? I know some think we live in a simulation or movie but turned me off from the franchise, as did the level design and feeling like I was taking some type of side by simply playing the game. Lots of great design to the game engine and possibilities are endless. Purchase on sale and have fun, not worth full price, I would recommend the devs create thier own world now, WW2 was decades ago and trying to keep true to the tech of that age.. what can you accomplish without constraints?

Great sniper game, with great performance, customization and mechanics for the sniper. Although objectives are not really based around it, which is a shame. Explosives are fun but difficult to work with when its a throw able over a wall. other weapons are what you would expect. Stealth mechanics are very good with many options being viable. BUT what really grinds my gears is the stupidness of the enemy AI. 3 modes with rest, search and active. with each having its faults. Rest people are given search effect if search effected enemies are nearby. This makes entire buildings light up if you throw a rock near an enemy. which by the way, only gets them distracted for like 2 seconds if they are on search mode. They also forget about you if you hide for 10 min. which is immersion breaking. There are also SO many enemies and sometimes stealth is not optional to new players. alot of replay ability though, with me wanting to do full stealth after a misson. shame you cant use cars but, i guess its a stealth game so it makes sense. Story is alright and kill cams are great.

This game succeeds at exactly what it wanted to be without allowing feature creep to influence it and without expanding into the same open world formula we see so commonly in the industry.  It strikes a great balance between linear progression and open map design.  You are able to approach each challenge in a variety of ways.  The movement and gun play is not as free as something from CoD or FarCry but the game is designed in such a way that it works great anyway.  The story is forgettable and characters are boring but none of that matters as soon as the kill cams start! 

It's just fun.

A good game, and probably the best Sniper Elite game, but a few things:

#1 - People complain about Sniper Elite 5, but already in 4, there are a fair number of times where it's fighting at like 50m or less, with weapons other than a rifle.

#2 - This one has very, very weird difficulty settings. The sniping on higher levels is hilarious... it must be constantly a hurricane-force wind, with Jupiter's gravity all of a sudden, when it's Authentic or Authentic+ or whatever. Why do I say this? Because just at like 100m the amount of wind correction is ridiculous, and the projectile drop is severe. Am I firing this thing at 100ft per second for muzzle velocity on those levels? The game drastically exaggerates those ballistic effects already at distances that aren't that far... 

#3 - NPC awareness is all over the place. Sometimes it's surprisingly good, with downing an enemy setting off a chain reaction of alerts and escalations. Other times, not so much.


Overall though, best level design of the SE series, best control of the series, and a good game.

It is a Sniper Elite game The Best WWII game IMHO. It does not have stupid cliches like boss fights or bullet sponge enemies and it is up to you how you complete the objective. If you like sneaky stealthy game with excellent combat mechanics get Sniper Elite 4 and 5. Is it re-playable? Yes. The missions are the same, but the way it will play out for you will be different each time. There are different ways you can play it. Stealth / Ghost / No damage, or a full on commando (if you like dying a lot that is). Difficulty can be adjusted from really easy where your enemies are blind and your bullets fly on a straight line, to a very difficult with smart enemy and bullet ballistic trajectory. The harder your setting the less aid you have and the more aggressive the foe is. On full "authentic" mode is it really hard, if you want the challenge.

I definitely like the shooting Nazis part, it's a lot of fun. Gaining ranks is a bit of a grind, particularly since my college background makes me personally feel slightly offended to start as anything less than Lieutenant (but that's a very personal matter).

And, some of the rank insignias are very confusing. They use the gold leaf of Major for one of the "Lieutenant" ranks, then Captain eventually gets the silver bar of a First Lieutenant, and the bars of a Captain are used for a Major.

One detail that's really bothered me is that there is no Swastika in this game about Nazis. I get the Germanic Iron Cross is also valid, but honestly, this is disappointing more than anything.

All that's missing is Sniper Elite set in WW3, and it'd be 11/10.

I got into SE4 almost 5 years after it was released. In fact, I had purchased SE5 first. Liked 5, but absolutely LOVE 4.

For all of '5's technical improvements and refinements (and there are many), it doesn't have the heart and vibe of the combat that SE4 captures so well. The AI level in 5 is sleepy sometmes, whereas 4 is high energy without being arcade.  I want to go back to missions already completed and play them again. They remain engaging.

Buy SE4, learn its systems, and enjoy the BEST "you against the world" combat game out there. And I've played most all of the others. SE4 is a landmark  game.

Sniper Elite 4 is just amazing!

 It has gorgeous maps and the map design encourages tons of alternative ways to approach each campaign mission. 
Gun customisation is barebones but weapon upgrades challenge you to get better and try more things other than just going for headshots. Rebellion has managed to make a game that is both gorgeous to look at and fun to play. If you think it's easy, then increase the difficulty (Sniper Elite is the ideal difficulty to play this game imo.) The DLC missions are absolutely worth it with deathstorm 2&3 offering the best balance of challenge and fun to be had. Only disadvantage of the game is it's single player/co-op with little to no multiplayer community to be found. However it has great replay value if you hunt for the mission challenges, collectables and weapon camos. If you like stealth/sniper games, it's one if not the best out there. I bought it on sale about two years ago and I still come back to it...!!

Cons:
- Console Movement (= garbage)
- 3rd Person Perspective instead of 1st ruins immersion and allows you to see over and around obstacles
- Enemy AI. You can kill one of them and they only run around a bit, give up after a few minutes and go on with their day. It never feels like you're in actual combat.
- Game should be called Commando Elite. Because you don't do that much sniping. Most other weapon options get the job done quicker and quieter.
- It has the same cancer most modern games have. 80% of the game is filled with guns and items that are all DLC. The rest has to be unlocked. None of that shit is needed. By now i feel like game developers don't even question those things and just put them in because they assume gamers expect that. Imagine their surprise if they found out that less would be more...

Pros:
- Level Design is solid. The maps offer various ways to solve them and interact with the world, they look good despite the old engine, they offer interesting lines of sight and challenges, they have a pretty atmosphere and it's fun to explore what can be done on them.
- Systematically clearing a map of enemy troops is fun. Especially if you set yourself your own challenges. The core game loop is solid. And that's really what it comes down to at the end.

I have mixed feelings about Sniper Elite 4. This game has has a serious identity crisis. The UI and marketing tout this game as a sniper simulator, about laying traps and sneaking into the right position to take [i]the shot[/i], but the game's mechanics and design cause it to play more like a 3rd person run & gun shooter featuring GRATUITIOUS VIOLENCE KILL ANIMATIONS!

It's easier to play that way- being sneaky requires an exhausting amount of patience and sniping at range is subject to wildly exaggerated wind and bullet drop (though even these are handheld for you on all but the hardest difficulties). There is often practically no penalty for being discovered and just going in loud, gunning down hordes of incompetant nazis with the ridiculous arsenal of weapons the player character can lug around.

If you get shot, just use a medkit to instantly and completely heal multiple bullet wounds! If you get overwhelmed, just run off a few meters and they'll forget all about you. The AI has no strategic capabilities and nearby groups of enemies will often be completely unaware of your presence despite having cut their buddies in half with automatic weapons just 50m away.


These problems can be somewhat alleviated with the game's difficulty customization, allowing you to make the enemies a little less brainless and the combat a little more punishing, but the casual-focused game design leave this an incomplete solution: For example, the options to see your own healthbar, use wallhack vision, or have the game aim for you are all under one single toggle.

[b]That's right: If you want to be able to check your own health, you must have wallhacks and other handholds enabled.[/b]

It's clear just from a multitude of decisions like this one that the game's hardcore stealth and sniping offerings are an afterthought tacked onto a more casual sniping-themed third person shooter.

In addition, design decisions such as locking singleplayer content behind a doomed multiplayer mode leave me scratching my head at who could have possibly thought these were good decisions.

Sniper Elite 4 is not a bad game. It is, however a confused mess of good and bad ideas which wants to be everything to everyone, and suffers in all categories as a result.

It's worth a try on on sale- just don't expect anything too challenging or realistic.

Sniper Elite 4 is a game whose good parts overwhelmingly outweigh its bad parts. It's extremely cinematically pleasing, with amazing special animations for shots through critical parts of the body, such as the head, and has a very high replay value. There are numerous weapons to choose, each with their own strengths and weaknesses. I personally enjoyed using the revolver as my sidearm and a scoped bolt action as my main. 

There are also so many different ways to play the game. You can stealth your way through entire levels, or just say screw it and go in guns blazing. You can set traps and throw grenades. You can even enable Coriolis and have to compensate for distance and wind for added challenges. 

The only thing that bothers me about the game, really, is that whether a weapon is suppressed or not depends on ammo, not the weapon itself. It makes no sense to me that the ammo is the limiting factor in use of suppressed weapons rather than a durability feature on a suppressor, but  guess it was the easier way to do things.

At any rate, I regard the game fondly and will probably play it again sometime.

My biggest problem with this game comes from its difficulty:

The highest difiiculty is 'authentic plus', which is anything but authentic, e.g. if you set 'ammo abundance' to authentic plus it just means that every enemy will carry 3 bullets, if you set 'enemy toughness' to auhtentic plus, it means that they will shrug off a .30-06 round to the chest, multiple times. Not to mention also that playing in this difficulty means that you dont get the red marker when you aim, makes sense right? except that there is no way to learn how to compensate for bullet drop, the markers in the scope are literally just for show, they mean nothing at all, plus the devs said pre-release that this is the first time they had zeroing for the rifle scope, really? in a SNIPING game? and don't get me wrong, i like the feeling of just nailing every shot to the head when playing in a difficulty that allows de red marker to know exactly where your bullet will go, but if you want to have an 'authentic experience', then at the very least give us a way to learn how to shoot instead of just guessing

I am a 44 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you were supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he helped me. Loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I've finished this game for a very long time and forgot to give a review. this is my review for this game

Pros :
‚Ä¢	for the story, it's actually okay, not good and not bad, but it's enough to describe World War II which was very stressful
‚Ä¢	the sound of gunfire is really very tense, almost the same as in the real world, especially sniper as the main shot in this game
‚Ä¢	for this graphic is very beautiful and pleasing to the eye, we can travel around the world in the 90s well
‚Ä¢	The slow motion bullet animation until it hits the head until it cracks is a feature that I really like because it is very satisfying to kill
‚Ä¢	The direction of the wind and the distance in this game are very carefully considered so that we don't just shoot

Cons : 
‚Ä¢	very stupid but aggressive ai sometimes we can trick them sometimes they act out of the blue so i feel inconsistent with ai
‚Ä¢	the stealth kill animation is average but sometimes very useful but I just don't like it
‚Ä¢	run and hide animation is very poorly polished, feels clunky
‚Ä¢	unsatisfactory ending

Conclusion :  this game really pays attention to the gameplay on sniper as a core mechanic but there are some things that need to be improved for the next game, and the story should be even better in my opinion

I've played only the Sniper Elite 1945, so this is my first encounter with the ''newer'' parts of the series.

So, I bought this game when it was on sale (85%) off, but it is totally worth its full price, even today. The missions take 45min -1,5 hours to complete(maps are really big), depending on how precise you are. I played it on Sniper Elite (Hard) difficulty and with doing all the optional objectives it took me around 18 hours to complete the campaign. I'm now replaying it in Authentic Plus and listen to me when I say: The game is much more enjoyable on Authentic difficulties. Longshots are much more rewarding and you feel like a real sniper when you shoot some nazi from 200m with strong wind.

I don't play multiplayer, so I can't review it. But maybe I'll try it later.

To adress the game's actual state: Graphics look very good even today, but I noticed that they are actually better in gameplay than in cutscenes. The story is very simple and, for most of the time, I just ignored it and focused on shooting Germans to ballz. I haven't encountered any lags/bugs through my whole game experience.

EDIT: After playing through the whole series to this point (except 5) I can say that this is by far the best Sniper Elite game out here, even better than SE5 - some other titles in this series may have better gun customization or wider range of weapons, but this is, by far, the most enjoyable Sniper Elite.

Final rating: 9/10

After over 100-hour gameplay, I managed to finish the game (including DLC missions) on the Authentic+ difficulty. The highest difficulty is challenging which requires patience. It is an unique experience what no one should miss.

Compared to its predecessor, Sniper Elite 4 has much bigger maps. This means, players have more ways to finish the missions. Of course, it also means that each mission takes longer to finish.

Graphics are stunning and physical mechanics are impressive. It makes me want to go Italy in the future.

During my gameplay, I did encounter a few problems. One noticeable problem was that my character cannot move freely when he was in cover. This is not common but can be pretty annoying.

Nevertheless, Sniper Elite 4 is still very fun and I would highly recommend it to anyone who like to play stealth games.

Game's not fun. I came onto this off of playing SE5, and the mechanics require the patience of a saint. Walking's too fast and noisy, and creeping's way too slow. I'm playing on the Sniper Elite difficulty coz I thought I was doing super well on that one with the fifth installment, I'm making headway at a much reduced pace in this one. At least the save points were okay(pretty much anywhere you like). There's way too many enemies to make a smooth pacifist run - not that you're rewarded for it, and if you start shooting they're onto you like flies, even with judicious use of ammo from various points(to avoid triangulation).

I'm calling it quits here, a few missions in. I'm at the monastery level and I'd just cleared the castle of enemies for the 'King of the Castle' part of the mission..it's not fun enough for me to continue.

edit: I've since finished the game and all its DLCs, out of sheer spite. I've learnt to understand how the alert stages don't mean anything in terms of completion and how you can simply run to other mission points if you wish to shrug off your red status. My last gripe with this game became obvious when I kept searching for mission items: they're well hidden to the point of frustration. In covert missions, the longer you wander(in my case, looking for stuff with little to no clues other than the huge mission circle) the more you're exposed, and I tend to mitigate this by just cleaning out the area. 

Anyway, I'm not incentivized in the least to repeat missions for the sake of completion, even with the new selectable characters. Deleted.

I like the sniper elite series although I remember being a bit disappointed with 3. This one I really liked - I must have as I spent 100 hours on the solo campaign and 4 dlcs. Collectables are a bit annoying. I usually want to get them all and in this game I nearly ended up killing every soldier just in case they had one! Thankfully after 2 or 3 missions I missed something and didn't feel like going to find it so that broke the necessity for the following missions. The worst thing about this game is what I have found in other games which can be played with stealth or open combat - the environment models have not been checked and optimised for stealth. So many times I was sneaking about and suddenly I stopped moving because the ground had a tiny step that was treated like a wall, or when crawling prone the engine decided that there was not enough space and I stood up! This meant that I was saving regularly so that I could replay just to compensate for these flaws.

I purchased the deluxe edition for less than ¬£10 in a sale, making it excellent value for money. I have never paid full price for any game so I'm biased, but the current price for a 2017 game does seem a bit high.
Highly recommenced, best of the series so far.

For all the flak I've given Sniper Elite 5, it's only fair that I give credit where credit is due. Sniper Elite 4 is an excellent game, and I would even say that it ranks as one of my all-time favourites. Just about everything about this game is great and I've played the campaign more times than I can remember. Whenever I'm feeling bored and wanna shoot a bunch of fascists right in their stupid faces, Sniper Elite 4 is my go-to, because it's satisfying, it's polished, it's fun and it's replayable. If Karl wasn't the most generic tough-guy commando imaginable and actually had some sort of personality, I would hang this game on my wall. I might even go as far as to say it's a masterpiece.

So, a quick rundown of how SE4 works: You play as Karl Fairburne, an elite Allied commando with a vast set of deadly skills. Skills so deadly in fact, that they killed any semblance of a personality he might have had. Karl's main job is to find Nazi Wunderwaffe and then make them explode until they stop working. When he's not doing that, his job is to find Nazi stuff in general and make it explode until it stops working. This extends to Nazis in general, in that if you shoot one in the heart, brain or liver, then that organ explodes and stops working, which in turn makes the person in question stop working. What's great about Sniper Elite 4 is that it gives you a fair bit of freedom on how to do that, and what's even better is that all of them are fun.

Your options for exploding the artillery, tanks, trucks, and cranial cavities of the world are varied. You can pull off shots from extreme distances (It's called Sniper Elite after all), you can pick enemies off with your rifle and play cat and mouse as you switch positions and lay traps for them to find, or you can lurk in the shadows, silently taking them out in close quarters. Or you can set the difficulty to cadet and pretend you're John Rambo. Either way, these are the strategies available to you, and what's beautiful about Sniper Elite 4 is the fact that all of them work, they're not mutually exclusive, and all of them are satisfying. That might not seem like a big deal, but that's a culmination of a number of things, which I'll go over next.

The level design in SE4 is amazing. They're beautiful to look at, they're atmospheric, they're absolutely crammed full of small details and you could explore them for hours. They even took the time to give every pre-placed enemy soldier a name and some background, which occasionally even ties in with the NPCs around it. I would say it's almost comparable to what Rockstar does. 300 hours in, there's still probably parts of the maps I haven't wandered into or things I haven't noticed. From a gameplay perspective, they're also very well designed and crafted to enhance the experience of the game. There's a great combination of high vantage points, open areas, tight corridors, chokepoints and alternative routes. What does this mean? It means you have the freedom to to pick whatever strategy you want and approach the objective however you'd like. That's what's important. The levels have enough variety that you can sit on a cliff and pop heads from 200 meters, or sneak around in the bushes and around corners and slash throats, and often times you'll find yourself doing both. Ultimately, the levels are stunning to look at, fun to navigate, and very seldom linear. Perfectly tailored for a game of this type.

The weapons and gunplay in SE4 are also worth noting. Every weapon performs differently so that nothing feels redundant and they're balanced enough that all of them are viable. More to the point though, thanks to some excellent sound design and the infamous X-ray cam, they're all very satisfying to shoot. They're punchy, pretty responsive, and there's something about them that just feels impactful and great when you hit your mark. The recoil on the SMGs takes some getting used to, but I think that's mostly a matter of fairness more than anything. And the melee kills? If I went in-depth on how much I love the takedowns in this game, I'd probably look like a serial killer, so I'll say they're good and leave it at that. And again, what's great about the weapon system in SE4 is that it's tailored to every playstyle. If you wanna land shots from literally across the map, there's a rifle for that. If you wanna quickly take out 3 guys at the same time from point blank, you can do that too. The world is your oyster and you can crack it open with a .30-06 or a Fairbairn Sykes fighting knife, and this game makes it satisfying to do it either way.

The other great thing about SE4 is that you can play it no matter how casual or absurdly hardcore you are. The cadet difficulty offers a light romp through the park. The authentic plus difficulty offers terror, paranoia and suffering at every turn. The other difficulties offer some nicely placed steps in between. That's one of the reasons I've gotten so much out of this game, actually. If you ever get bored, the two highest difficulties offer no shortage of challenges, and they actually play quite differently from the others.

Now, as much as I love this game, it's got a few flaws, but they're few enough that I can wrap them up quickly in one paragraph. The Sniper Elite series is never going to win any awards for writing. The missions as standalones are fine and there's nothing jarring about them but the overarching plot feels like a B-Movie. The voice acting for the named characters isn't great (the generic NPCs you get to shoot at aren't bad though) and most of them are pretty forgettable. If Karl had a personality beyond being a stoic and the protagonist, I would probably comment on it here, but he doesn't, so that's that. Also, this is probably just my opinion but I absolutely hate the trench gun in this game. That, and Valkyrie snipers in survival mode are astonishingly unfair. And there you have it! The like, 5, things about this game I don't like that much. Everything else about it is absolutely solid. I absolutely love this game.

Maybe the reason I'm so disappointed by Sniper Elite 5 is because this game, its immediate predecessor, set the bar for it too high. Still, regardless of what I think of the new instalment, or the titles before it or the zombie spin-offs, I can't deny that this game is one of my all-time favourites. So, giving credit where credit is due, Sniper Elite 4 is a fantastic game, I have almost nothing but praise for it, and I wholeheartedly recommend it.

This game is great. It is in my top 20 if not top 10 best games I have every played. Every issue I had with the first three games in the this series were solved in this game. AI was much better than previous games. Level maps were much much better. In the earlier games it seemed that Karl closed his eyes when he shot his smg or mg; in this game he seems to keep at least one eye open. The stealth mechanics was heavy improved. The story was good, could have be better. That is my only real complaint about this game. The gameplay is enough to carry the lack of a great story. I see myself playing this game again. Cannot say that about the first three games.  The game is just great.

This old guy would like you to know that this really is an enjoyable game. The original stuff plus the add-ons "kill Hitler" and the other 3 DLC's. You just need to try it out. The scenery/resolution is good. The stories are a bit corny but fun. Nothing technically too taxing (see Sniper 5). You just have to choose/revolve the right weapons for the different situations, keep up your health and have a decent idea of the story/map layouts. Hours of harmless fun. The Xray exploding bodies is really not too gross. I tried Sniper 5 on the back of this but it was far too detailed by comparison...you know, allow for bullet drops/windage etc. Who needs it. Life is too short. You just want to kill the Nazi's/Italians and progress the games. Thoroughly recommend this. Only problem is that I've played it so often I need to get a new game now and, so far, can't see anything half as good.

The best of the franchise, yes, even better than 5. SE4 is where Rebellion expanded the sandbox with intricate, massive maps allowing for a variety of approaches, and also expanded your toolset to enable more creativity. It's almost like a WW2 take on Hitman. Progression, unlocks, and rewards are all well integrated and feel good to earn. I'm not sure whether Rebellion will ever top this game, SE5 is good but SE4 remains the benchmark.

I am a 46 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 12 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he friended and invited me to join him. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

In the last 2 years of being an exclusive PC gamer, I bought quiet some Steam deals. This evolved to a certain mindset where I won't invest further time in a X game if I'm not really enjoying it and having fun. I never played a Sniper Elite game before, so instead of buying 5 full price, I went for a sale price on SE4. And O M G, what a blast! 1 Of the funnest games I have gamed in a loooonngg while. Popping x-ray headshots never get old. I finished the game on normal and now I'm doing it on hard, after that, I'll prob go for the hardest difficulty. Not because I need to, but because I just don't want to quit playing this game. I wishlisted SE3 and 5, so 1 day I'll get those and play them aswell. Thx to SE4, I even might buy and play Sniper Ghost Warrior 2. Although I'm having much fun with the game, I kinda bugs me that the scopes aren't really helping for the extreme long range headshots. Sure you can activate & use an immaculate aim assist, but I want to pop heads from +500m range without aim assist. Aim assists are for noobs. If you are doubting whether this game will be to hard or not for you, like i just said 1 there is an immaculate aim assist that can help you learn the basics. And 2 if you play on easy, there is no bullet drop nor wind effects. On normal only bullet drop but no wind effects. On hard you do have both, wind effect and bullet drop, so you can just play the game and learn as you are playing it & having extreme fun while shooting x-ray headshots, or x-ray testicle shots if that's more your thing :P
Frequent Corrupt Save Errors, end up reseting your profile and making you lose all progress. Had to be fixed. (This is the single game I experience this so far)

The game is visually very beautiful, the gameplay is fun and offers varying levels of challenging if you so wish to have one. Each mission is large scale with plenty to do any plenty of enemies to deal with. Overall if you like stealth games or games about marksmanship then this is a good game to play.

damn good game. 'tis all I have to say.

Great game where you can fight and/or sneak your way through open levels that leave a lot up to the player to decide. The gun play is very satisfying and every gun feels unique and has it's own mastery challenges. The maps are quite big, and each and every one of them feels quite unique. And there's a lot of secondary objectives and achievements to keep you busy for quite a while. 

It's also nice to see that the difficulty levels are quite well implemented. Authentic Plus (The highest difficulty) is a real challenge without enemies feeling like bullet-sponges like you would often see in other games.

I love the game, while still kinda janky its basically an open world Sniper Elite that retains its previous concepts. Stealth is actually fun.

You do have to acknowledge the game is janky. VERY janky. Think of it as a WW2 version of a janky MGS V. Hit detection can be janky, ballistics can be janky, line of sight and communications between enemies can be janky, animations can be janky. Checkpoints can be janky. If you acknowledge that the game can be seriously fucking janky and have an unfinished edge to it, you will have fun.

The multiplayer is pretty much dead, so all you can do is play the 8 main missions (with a cool plot twist at the end and a mediocre ending) and the 4 DLC (which tbh i fucking hated them, their way of balancing them was to make as few checkpoints as possible and it fucking sucks) And that's about it.

Here's hoping SE5 can be better.
add FOV slider and you have a good game. It's too low and the character fills the screen. The same problem is in MGSV. Third Person Stealth games need this.

This is the first review I write, and it is largely because it goes against the grain of what others have said.

I regret buying this game, despite buying it at a vast discount. It does not feel like you are a sniper - it feels like you are some kind of a super solider, sent out to kill hundreds of enemies. I was hoping for a climatic, patient game, but instead got something that feels like CoD. The shooting mechanics are fine, but the mission design is disappointing.

The worst thing about the game are the story and the characters. They would be better of being cut from the game, and us just being thrown into sniper missions with little backstory. The main character is insufferable, one of those people who think they are cool but really are not, and all the side characters are equally grating, being unbelievably tropey and only speaking in cliches. I have not heard a single normal sentence being uttered in this game. Everybody speaks like they are written by an 11-year-old.

As regards to the story, it is ridiculous, and really takes me out of the game. Nazis have a super-weapon and it is your mission to kill everybody who works on it, Nazis have a railgun and it is your mission to disable it to prove yourself to a bossy resistance chick that you can be trusted... Spare me.
