A great Single-player and Co-op military shooter in every aspect. It's all in the details. 

Firstly, the graphics are excellent. Whether it's a sun-drenched paradise, or a dark and smoky warzone, every environment looks moody and cinematic, yet crisp. You don't need to worry about visibility being obscured due to poor rendering or effects. Every setting manages to look beautiful without getting in the way of the gameplay, and the level of detail is just right. If you can't see where you're getting shot from, it's because you're not looking in the right place, sniper.

The audio design is superb as well, although the dynamic range is quite high. Sounds are detailed, and you can get a real sense of where enemies are by how their gunshots and voices echo around the environment in full stereo. However, things can get a little too quiet or a little too loud sometimes, depending on what audio setup you select. It's just another setting you need to experiment with a little bit before finding the right one. 

The range of difficulty settings is a big plus as well. These not only affect the strength of opposing forces, but also the game's physics as well. Being able to change these key details is difference that can make this game feel either very casual, or like a hardcore military simulation. This is especially handy when inviting friends to play in co-op. 

OK, now onto the gameplay: The real satisfaction of playing this game isn't just the gory slow-mo cutscenes when pulling off the perfect shot from hundreds of yards away, but the blend of strategy and tactics that the action revolves around. You really are a one-man army, and thinking like a trained killer helps you to, well, kill everyone. 

The game offers opportunity to approach each objective in a completely stealthy, or gung-ho manner, but most of the time you are going to be somewhere in the middle. Taking out some enemies with complete stealth is satisfying and is often the best way sometimes, but isn't always going to be possible. Enemy behavior is detailed and varies greatly, and the visibility mechanic allows the player to slip in and out of stealth and combat situations fluidly, just like a real sniper would. 

You are going to be spending a lot of time setting traps, studying topography and retreat routes, enemy locations and armaments, and even then, something might happen to ruin your plan of attack. This adds a sense of depth and realism to the battlefield, and few games are able to pull this off they way SE4 has mastered it. But never does it become tedious, or very frustrating. No matter what the challenge is, you can save and restart at any point in each mission, allowing you to experiment and find what works. 

There is a lot of equipment at your disposal, both from your loadout as well as drops in game, ranging from all sorts of rifles to submachineguns, shotguns, and pistols as well as mines, TNT, etc. - so you are never trapped into any one gameplay style, and are prepared for any situation. This becomes even more interesting in co-op mode. 

Overall, it's a great time spent within well crafted open world environments. Playing through a single level from start to finish can be as quick as you can run from one side to the other, or take up several hours leading enemies around on a wild goose chase as you slowly dispatch them in awesomely gruesome fashion, depending on how you approach things.

Pros:
Game with interesting and attractive story.
Intuitive and easy gameplay.
Weapon customization.
Thematic setting is very rich and detailed, with beautiful landscapes.

Cons:
Engine dated from the Sniper Elite 3, it's about time they used another one.
The character and other NPCs look like wax dolls if the quality is not at Ultra.
The graphic quality of the characters leaves something to be desired.
Heavy game for cards like GTX 1050 Ti and GTX 960 or lower.
The way to upgrade weapons is not very intuitive and requires a lot of effort, it's not for everyone...
There are only two silenced pistols and one is DLC.
Rifle with silencer in DLC only.
Some locations allow you to shoot enemies from more than 550m away, but the zoom of the weapons does not reach and you are forced to improvise plan B.

Tips.
Rifles are difficult to upgrade, so I recommend using only 1 rifle for the entire career, one of the rifles with the best range is the Carcano M91/41, it has the possibility of great zoom, and on maps where you can hit enemies at great distances, it helps a lot, but the bad thing about it is the frequency of fire, it fires very slowly, because it's a bolt-action rifle.
If you are going to give up range and prefer a rifle that fires faster, I recommend the G43, it fires fast and has a range for enemies up to approximately 250mts.
Whichever you choose, just use one rifle, go through this rifle upgrades and see what you have to do to improve range, accuracy, fire rate, etc.

This a premier shooter that will test anyone's skill.  If you don't want something surrealistic or silly like Fornite, and want realism, this is the shooter for you.  I won't knock the Far Cry series, though, and they have surreal elements.   Far Cry is the real deal.   And the enemies look like people, not cartoons.  I just can't take games like Fortnite seriously.  I don't even consider that game a real shooter.   It's rare for the strength of a game to be its campaign like SE4.  Most games today want MP action so they can milk money with DLC.  Sniper Elite 4 has a great and challenging campaign.  The DLC missions are great, also.  I have them all.  And have mastered every weapon.  Which doesn't give any achievement but I did it anyways.  

Multi-player in SE4?  Kind of stupid.  Much of it is team-oriented.  No cross.  Defend the flag.  Ho hum.  I tried the urban map free-for all in MP and it was really stupid.  We ran around that town shooting each other with players getting killed and re-spawning like every 30 seconds.  I don't think anybody lived a minute without going down.  Everybody dying so many times in a match it was ridiculous.  You kill somebody and die 10 seconds later.   Rinse and repeat.  Dumb de dumb dumb.  No matter how skilled they are they die like flies in MP.  In this game somebody might brag about getting a thousand PVP kills when they themselves have been killed more than a thousand times.  But then there are other games like that.  RPG's and shooter alike.  Like the people who die like flies in GTA5.  They think they're good, but you see them getting whacked constantly.

Hopefully Rebellion won't screw up SE5.  I thought about pre-ordering but then I saw they were going to allow "drop-in" multi-player snipers in campaign mode.  Well then it's not really Single Player then, is it?  What, are they going to allow this is Survival Waves, too?  No one would ever complete a Survival Mode on Hard if player snipers get to fight with your AI opponents in SE4.  The idea just seems to be asinine.  So I didn't pre-order.  Hopefully they'll have a Demo so I can check it out.  If there is no way to stop the "drop-in" of other players i won't buy the game.   Although I urge others to try SE4, I didn't do the same for earlier editions of the series.   I didn't like SE3 at all.  I thought they ruined that game's potential with their confining maps and confining lay-outs.  It was like you were in a cattle chute.  With Rebellion it's hit or miss.  Winner or another stinker in the next installment? We'll know later this year.

[b]Sniper Elite 4[/b] is, for the most part, a very well made and enjoyable game. It looks excellent, with splendid graphics that are highly customisable for PCs of various specifications. Sound effects are also excellent and, just like the graphics, there are options to configure them to your preference. Controls are likewise and you can also play with a gamepad, instead of the mouse and keyboard, due to it being released on the consoles. I have played previous games in the series on the XBox and it works just as well, whatever your preferred control method.

Difficulty options are fully customisable, giving you a choice of how much calculation you will need to get that shot from your sniper rifle to hit the target (wind, elevation to compensate for distance, leading the target, etc.) and how good the AI enemies are. This means that if you want to play with more aggressive enemies but keep easier sniping characteristics, for instance, you can do so.

The game is largely stealth, what with you being a sniper, but there is provision for playing the game in a more up front, direct approach if you have to fight your way out of a situation. The great thing about the game is that once you are dropped into the mission, it is up to you how you tackle the objectives. Each mission is set on a large map, with intelligent and varied design. There are multiple approaches to each objective, rather than being forced to play it only one way. It is up to you what you want to do and in what order you want to do it. That level of freedom goes a long way into enhancing the enjoyment of the game. Each mission can take you a long time to play.

There is plenty of room for creativity, due to your choice of weapons, different approaches and whatever is in the environment. You might want to hide in bushes or the shadows (and shoot out lights if needed), going for stealthy shots or knife takedowns. You might want to shoot an explosive object, taking out nearby enemies or shoot some part of the environment that crashes down onto a target. You might want to create a distraction, masking your noise or sending enemies elsewhere.

There are plenty of sniper rifles to choose from, with various statistics. There is no perfect rifle and there are pros and cons to each, some being bolt action or semi-auto, having less power or a better ranged scope, for instance. The same applies to the sub-machine guns, shotguns, revolvers and pistols. There are camouflage customisation options for the guns, as well as unlocks that enhance their capability as you achieve their individual challenges.

You have a choice of explosive weapons too, such as fragmentation grenades, landmines, timed explosives and tripwire anti-personnel mines. Each of these devices has a secondary function and can be used as booby traps.

The damage you cause can often show a slow motion close-up of the bullet travelling through the air and then going into your target, whether it is a human being, a vehicle or explosive object. If you have the X-ray graphic option selected, it is always gruesome as you watch the bullet shatter bone and burst organs.

This was always one of the main features of the [b]Sniper Elite[/b] series but is probably over the top. The bullets from your sniper rifle, despite not being more than an intermediate calibre, always rip through bone and organs and retain enough velocity to exit the body. As long as you hit a vital organ, no matter the range (and even if you at the maximum range of your rifle), it will over penetrate and act like something more powerful than a battle rifle.

That leads me onto a gripe with the game and one that can occasionally cause frustration. If you don‚Äôt hit a vital organ, the enemies are stupidly resilient at times. This is less obvious with the sniper rifles but can be a problem when using the SMGs and sidearms. If you are trying to be stealthy and trying to take out a guard with a pistol, and the first shot doesn‚Äôt kill, they suddenly seem to get an alerted status health increase. Despite being shot but not dying and recoiling in pain, they will now start dancing around like a cross between James Brown, Elvis Presley and the Sugar Plum Fairy. They will shimmy, body lock and pop, slip, slide and trip over, acting like they are in a drunk dance off, as opposed to actually being hit by bullets. This then gives them enough time to let everyone else know that you are there.

The shotguns are good but the SMGs are all quite weak but have a lot of recoil (some making anything more than semi-auto fire useless). Thankfully, all is not lost if you are detected and you have a chance to fight your way out and make it to relative safety. On Normal difficulty, the enemy AI can be quite hesitant before they co-ordinate an attack. However, the days of the first Sniper Elite game, where the AI would have laser-like accuracy (and all be carrying MG42s) and know exactly where you are, even if they didn‚Äôt see where you ran off to hide, are long gone! Checkpoint saving is frequent too, on the lower difficulties.

Those points aside, it really is an enjoyable game to play. You can also play the game co-operatively through missions or wave survival. The DLC is excellent too!

Shooting lots of Nazis, what else do you need?

This is one of those shooters that never gets old. When you've had enough, go play something else and a couple months later you'll pick of just where you left.

Multiplayer is mostly dead by now, naturally, but there's at least 100 hours of fun (I'm still not finished) in the single-player alone. Multiple difficulties (starting quite easy but ramping up a lot), enough missions to keep it diverse and DLC that actually adds a lot of extra gameplay. Buy the base game first (unless you can get a good deal on the package, the base price is a bit much but there are discounts every so often), shoot through the missions and get the DLC if you're wanting for more.

Some of the challenges are crazy dangerous and really take some extra practice. All of them are optional, so you can ignore any that are too far out of your playing style. In the DLC, you get to off Hitler himself. There are plenty of achievements encouraging you to get creative with just that.

Absolutely gorgeous levels! Beautiful, a lot of verticality, freedom of approach, but not so much that you get lost.

Balance feels a little iffy and guns/skills progression is not at all noticeable, but I guess aren't the focus.

[h1]I found Sniper Elite 3 more enjoyable than 4 due to the environments and kill opportunities but that's not to discredit Sniper Elite 4 as its Italian Scenery and Campaign Maps are stunning and offer close to the same enjoyment.[/h1]

[i]Sniper Elite 4 was developed by Rebellion and is available for $84.95AUD or $12.74AUD during sales. I highly recommend if you're new to the franchise that you either purchase during sales and if you're not sure if you'll enjoy it try Sniper Elite 3 beforehand due to its cheaper price tag during sales.[/i]

Sniper Elite 4 offers the same gameplay as its predecessor as it's a third person shooter with first person sniping. It offers an 8 mission solo campaign and a co-op experience is available for those who wish to experience it. 

The sniping experience offers various difficulties as you can make numerous adjustments to match your preference, Bullet Velocity/Fall Off/assists... If you wish to experience the game casually you can and if you want a more accurate sniping experience, it's on the table as well.

While the game is a shooter, it offers a stealth system by using loud environmental factors to mask the sound of your shots, thus allowing you to eliminate the Nazi's and complete your objective without raising the alarm or entering close quarter combat.

Lastly the Killshot Camera returns by providing stunning showcases of your various kills and the internal impact they have upon your victim. 

[b]Sniper Elite 4 is definitely worth a playthrough but unlike its predecessor I would only recommend Sniper Elite 4 during a sale as the base price is rather steep and unchanged in 2022.[/b]

This game is really well done, I love the world war 2 setting, and roaming around Italy during 1943 is really amazing to see. 
Planning your every move in this game pays off well for a player with patience, but you could easily also play this game run and gun no problem. I love how the levels are all sandbox environments, with multiple ways to plan your attack in each level. The only negative I can think of is the terribly easy AI.. The only time enemies are a decent challenge is when you're on Authentic difficulty. Every other difficulty and they're incredibly easy to take care of. The story is also pretty good, but I just don't think that the story itself is what makes this game. Inception, Infiltration, and Target F√ºhrer, are all good dlc and I would also say to pick those up as well. I'm not a huge fan of the weapons and skins dlc's but that's just me.

‚Ä¢ [url=https://discord.gg/zxJaNeaAqJ] Discord server [/url][/quote]

[h1]If it ain't broke, don't fix it[/h1]

We are back as Karl Fairburn, the English commando without an English accent. He will be busy in Italy stopping the Axis powers from unfolding their plans while helping the allies progress.

Throughout the game, you will have your main and secondary objectives to complete. Though, the way you decide to do them is totally up to you. With wonderful mechanics, be sneaky, bloody or on a romantic date with your rifle. This game indeed allows you to try different tactics and to enjoy it.

[b]Sniper Elite 4[/b]'s biggest improvement is regarding the levels. They are huge and way more complex than the three previous games. Don't get mistaken though, the game can be tough and understanding ballistics at higher difficulties will become a challenge. As a matter of fact, make sure to target the head or an organ as a bullet in the leg won't slow them at all. I found the stealth mechanics to be somehow lacking, the AI will just stop searching after a while no matter the body that they can see down the road.

Sadly, I have been experiencing some issues using the melee combat from time to time. I never really figured out if I could stab from that specific angle or not. Which led me to mash the buttons, it would then either work or I would stay crouched looking at that Nazi dead in the eye in an ''oh shit'' moment. Some other times, mashing the button would make me pick up a body rather than stabbing the Nazi baited by the trap I was setting.

Aesthetically, the game is pleasing. Congratulations to Rebellion for the different landscapes, maps, villages and forests you will encounter. Everything  feels and scream Mediterranean and makes the experience more enjoyable. The killcam is still extremely satisfying in Sniper Elite 4 and probably the best part of the game. Between the X-rays, slow motion, bones cracking and skulls exploding, this game is still the recipes on all the different ways to kill someone.

You understand now, no real surprises in this opus. The story is secondary but has its moments, the sheer number of collectibles will for you to replay the game. You will be able to run through the game in 12-14 hours that I promise you are going to be amazing.

Overall it's a good game, however the bullet mechanics are exaggerated which I find very annoying. Being a sniper game, i would have expected them to be somewhat more realistic.

I picked this up on Steam Sale to play co-op with a friend and after 7 hours we're loving up.  It's like Hitman insomuch as it allows to you play in a style that suits you, run in loud with an MG and grenades, keep your distance with a marksman rifle and let them come running to you, or use the environment to conceal your location and sneak your way through the map.

The ballistic modelling and influence of wind and muzzle velocity on bullet drop is nice compared to most shooters with laser bullets, but it can be a bit frustrating until you get used to he mechanics as there is often little in the way in indications as to where your shot landed, especially at 200m+.  There are some weird inconsistencies that don't make much sense with the mechanic too, like firing inside or down straight tunnels your shots still seem to drift because of "wind".

The graphics are nice, despite being 5 years old at this point, and the audioscape is nice too.  I've been playing on Authentic difficulty, and the AI doesn't feel completely dumb running at you blindly, they will flank and suppress, nor does it feel  unfair and aimbotty or like enemies are bullet sponges to artificially inflate difficulty.

The bullet killcams are pretty cool (can be disabled), I imagine I may get bored of them eventually, but they seem to be infrequent enough that they're fun, but not annoying.

Overall I'm really enjoying the game, there's lots of content, and you can sink 1.5+ hours into each mission if you want to, exploring and completing secondary objectives.  Based on this experience, I'm looking forward to Sniper Elite 5, coming later this year, and definitely recommend people giving this a try, particularly on sale.

Get the complete edition of this game while it's on sale. This is one of the best stealth shooters there is. If you enjoyed the original Hitman games like Silent Assassin, you'll enjoy this. If you are a fan of WW2-era weapons and history, you will enjoy this game even more. 

The story is great, the gameplay is great, the graphics are gorgeous, and it runs extremely well. Get together with a friend and take-on the campaign mode and see how many sets of testicles you can obliterate. 

The single-player modes have lots of replay value. There are at least 5 different ways to complete each mission and several side-missions with hidden lore and unlockable weapons and costumes. The challenges that earn you weapons upgrades and skins are actually fun without being too tedious, and teach you to use those weapons in ways that aren't necessarily apparent at first. 

This is a game that rewards patience and skill and makes you feel incredibly badass when you pull-off a long shot or a clever trap kill. I have been playing this game for at least 2 years and I keep going back to it when I need to blow off steam by eviscerating nazis. Killing Hitler never gets old, and there's so much content for completionist gamers to explore and unlock that, even at full-price and nearly 5 years since launch, it's still worthwhile. I cannot imagine how the 5th chapter of the game series will be able to top this one, but Rebellion is a development studio that hardly ever disappoints.
Perfect game
Beautiful game, and its the same Sniper Elite formula, for better or for worse depending on how you like that.

Overall, I think that the game is absolutely fantastic. Even on my laptop the graphics still look really good, and regarding the campaign this one had a pretty good story line and a great ending. Checking out the DLC missions and weapons is definitely worth it, especially when you have like 10 different ways to kill hitler. Game-play is smooth and the take-down animations are really refreshing. One downside would be that the customisation of individual weapon parts is not there like in Sniper elite 3. Upside would be that it was replaced with the weapon mastering system which in its own right makes it fun to grind, and also the huge amount of guns at your disposal which you adapt to in regards to your play style. I would also recommend Sniper elite V2 & 3 as they are also both great games. Definitely recommend if you love stealth games and killin nazis :).

I am strictly a single player, campain only player.
If you liked SE3 then SE4 is just as much, if not more fun.
Took 26hrs to get through all 8 missions on hard, each mission avg 65% complete, so lots of replay value.
The story carries the game along nicely, and I felt a sense of achievment by the end credits.

The gameplay is largely the same as in modern HITMAN and HITMAN 2 - the maps are completely open to you.
They are huge, there are numerous objectives to each map/mission, and you can approach all of them as you wish - snipe everyone from afar, gun blazing, stealth or lure your enemies into traps you set up...you can do them in any order you want and without a time limit.

This is the only Sniper Elite I will recommend.
SE and SE2 is too old and the movement/gunplay is too aged.
SE3 has its own problems, see the other people's reviews.
But SE4 is done just right.

If this is your first Sniper Elite game, this could be loads of fun. But having played Sniper Elite 1-3, this feels like one big reskin.

Sniper Elite 4 is a solid shooter. There are several game modes designed for amature beginners and seasoned veterans. If you like shooter games and wish to relax, there is a mode for you in which you feel like a super powered entity. If you wish to have to room for errors and be forced to adapt and think during every moment of the game, such pleasure is also available. There are multitudes of play styles, from long ranged sniper combat to melee take downs. Story mode contains several diverse and challenging missions. This game is worth getting for single player alone.

Play it.

Well, where to start. Multiplayer it totally dead. 20 players world wide. 
The reason I suspect is because multiplayer is terrible. The run speed is entirely too fast and the ballistics are highly exaggerated, a 300 yard/meter shot is tricky with wind here. You can miss shots entirely by not accounting for wind or drop at 150 yards. Irl a rifle zeroed at 100 yards can hit anything from point blank to say 350 yards without adjustment. Granted you might get a heart shot aiming at the head but its not 6 feet low.  Prone stability is not what it should be.

You literally can't go through the single player missions without killing anyone except the main guys. This turns the game into sort of call of duty tier non-sense. IRL a sniper probably takes 3 shots max on a mission? Guessing here but short of SHTF snipers don't go out and kill 20 people on a mission even the 5 from the first mission are... well... very risky. 

Don't get this game if you want realism i guess.

PVP in multiplayer is very slow phased, I recomend trying to comunicate with your team and you'll do just fine. The game fetures a lot of modes, CO-OP which is very fun with friends, or stuff like team death match which is pretty fast phased, there's a lot of mines etc. left out by the players so watch your steps.

The war time stories allow for a reasonable character arc but its the fun sniping experience that at first does a lot of the hard work of getting the shots just sweet...but progresses to you having to make your own decisions and improve as a sniper; tactics, movements, distractions; sniping skills and route planning.

This a great game; get it on sale and you will have one of the best value games out there!!

This was my first "sniping game" and I have thoroughly enjoyed it.  Took me about 15 hours to do the vanilla campaign the first time, then another 15 for the challenges, then another 40+ for the achievements, then about 20+ in co-op/survival.  At this point I haven't even touched the DLC missions.

As for the DLC, not a fan of paying for new weapons unless they come with a new map... but the devs have a number of weapons+skins packs.  I bought the season pass when it was on sale - otherwise I don't think I would've bought it.

There are a few annoyances in this game such as no FOV control; stuck in 3rd person when moving or firing secondary weapons (1st person only when zooming on rifle or binoculars); rarely sound/music bugging out when quicksaving/loading (requiring you to restart the game to fix); and AI occasionally being stupid or buggy.

SE4 is a not-too-serious stealth, combat game where you sneak around a map picking off enemies with your sniper rifle, stealth attacks or traps. This chapter in the series is set in the allied invasion of Italy and so covers scenarios set in Sicily, Naples, Cassino, etc.

This game can be fun if you switch off and dive into a clich√©-filled WW2 stealth game. Just don't take it too seriously or worry about realism. I recommend you turn up the difficulty level so the X-ray and mini-map cheats are not there to reveal the enemies: this slows the pace of the game down as you must be more careful, but the experience is better in my view.

Although this game has a good basic formula I think it's time for some innovations. For example improved AI or some new game play elements.

[h1]Positive[/h1]
[b]Level design[[/b] is well done, the maps contain a lot of paths, rooms, objects and atmosphere.

[b]It's not realistic[/b] this is important to set expectations for the game. It's not trying to be a military simulator with realistic sniping, you'll be disappointed if you want that. But it does pack a stealth/sniping game into maps where you spend an hour or two to hunt down maybe a hundred or more enemies, this format is not compatible with making a realistic experience but it fits a game experience.

[h1]Negative[/h1]
[b]Bullet camers[/b] have been a part of this series since the start, but I find them gross and disable them. The game could stand without them but it's too late now the series is known for them.

[b]Too many hints and cheats[/b] the default difficulty gives you too many hints to locate enemies. This makes it too easy. Turn off the X-ray vision and the minimap makes it a slower but more immersive experience. Shame the enemies still chat too much to give away their position or tell you they are reloading their guns.

[b]Slow upgrades[/b] it seems to take too long to earn the upgrades. I was just confused by the reward and progression system.

[b]Limited AI behavior[/b] seems the same as previous games. Probably time for innovations here in the next game to make the experience better.

A fun and satisfying blend of stealth, sniping, and action! Plus you can kill Hitler, which is always a bonus.

Solo and co-op are the best in any Sniper game I have played, plenty of run and gun a/v if that is your style too.

Can run the campaign with another player, the whole thing, not required.    (Note, each player on own PC/own game buy/install/internet connection, not local co-op)

You can do survival (1-4 players) with max 12 waves of increasing number of bots and plenty of tweaking of them to make it more to your liking, say you want NO radar (indicating location in EASY/NORMAL/HARD difficulties)  you can turn that off, the 2 difficulties above that, don't have the radar!

There is a Co-Op mode for 2 players only, that each of you takes a different path in the areas, one of you can Sniper only and the other does all the closeup magic, basically one on overwatch the other sneaking around, it's a blast!

Has built in voice chat and works well!

At level 30, all your perks slot will be open to you, highly recommend mastering out weapons as part of your learning the game strategy/leveling up, and plenty of help to be found via search if you need some nuance help!

If into PvP, that is out there too, but I'm all Co-Op in this one, outstanding, some bugs but nothing that made me rage quit, plus even if the internet is being a pain, it can be played off-line albeit some modes of play are not a/v then obviously.

One thing of note, no cross play with console players if that was important factor for you.

If you own Zombie Army 4, different flavor, but I like and play both and looking forward to SE5 next year!

Now a wonderful bargain game and still going back to it again and again!

Got this game mid-2020, but didn't play it until I got COVID in November of that year. I really wish I had started playing sooner. It was a blast, and a great way to relax and spend a couple hours while stuck in quarantine. I'm a casual gamer, so the lower-moderate difficulties were the perfect casual shooter experience. The freedom that this game gives you in how you tackle the challenges before you is unparalleled, you can run in guns blazing, or you can try and ghost mission (completing the mission without getting caught). The freedom is one of the many things this game has going for it. The Target Fuhrer DLC is also worth the price, I mean, you get to kill Hitler, who wouldn't wanna do that!? The campaign would introduce new challenges at every mission, keeping every mission a fresh experience. The story was a little lack-luster, but was fundamentally solid and I was more focused on headshotting Nazis to care all that much. The survival mode is also a blast, setting traps, picking enemies off from a distance, and blowing them away up close with a Double-Barreled Shotgun or Thompson. The fun factor gets a shot of steroids when you add friends to the mix, I can't tell you how many times my friends and I had an amazing time seeing who could get the most testicle shots, or blowing each other up with satchel charges. Now I've sung a lot of praise, but there is one thing to consider. The replay value is there for the campaign, but it's there with friends or upped difficulty. I will also say, if you are trying to gold all of the weapons (which I am currently doing) it can be a real grind sometimes (have you ever tired getting kidney shots on purpose?). In my opinion though, totally worth the price tag and I'm very excited for Sniper Elite 5. Just remember, if you can, have some friends join you, because video games are always better with friends!

Although this is a positive review i will cover both the good parts and the bad parts of this game and if you dont want or you dont have time to read all of it there i first wrote a summary.

[h1] The summary [/h1] 

This game is good. It has great mechanics the kills are satisfying and the location are varied enough that every level feels special with his own challenges to overcome and overall i recommend it.

[h1] The good [/h1] 

- [u]There is a difficulty for you. [/u] It does not matter if this is your first time holding a virtual sniper rifle or you are a  pc shooter veteran because there is a difficulty for you. If you want a more laid-back experience where you are running through bullets and popping nazi heads left and right i suggest you start on the normal or easy difficulty and getting to hard as you become more and more comfortable with the game mechanics but if you want a more ''realistic''  where you are hiding in a bush waiting for the perfect moment to strike and keeping track of your bullets in your your mag so you dont waste any of them when on the floor when you reload kind of  experience then you should start on hard and shorty after that move on to hardcore and hardcore+

- [u]The levels are great. [/u] They look pretty and having a lot of variation in their aspect it never feels like you are always stuck  in the same place doing the mission objectives with exploration being rewarded withuseful ammo and medkits and even soem secrets if you get lucky

- [u]The combat is fun. [/u] The ragdolls are funny the shooting feels great and the reloading animations are decent. The game has an aim assist that you can use from the difficulty easy to hard and putting a higher focus on map knowledge and enemy placement but hardcore and hardcore+ doesnt have an aim assist or a minimap and the enemies hit harder and you get spotted more easily. You will have to account for distance lenght from your target and wind speed if you ever want to get a headshot with the sniper rife again, you will have to choose your targets carefully and play more stealthy and using traps direct combat not being recommended without having a plan. 

- The gun variety in this game with all guns having differents strengths and weaknesses with thier stats getting better the more you use them

- [u] The killcams... oh boy....the killcams... are great![/u] showing you in detail where exactly you shot that german without being too gory or over the top, in my 120 hours i havent got bored of them yet but if you do you will probably be glad to find out that you can make them appear less  or disable them entirely in the options meniu. 

- [u] The dlcs maps are well made and i feel like they really add something to the experience[/u] and  in fact they were  my favorite! Although i will say that in a game about ww2 and shooting germans i feel like shooting hitler should be in the base game and not a dlc 

[h1] The bad [/h1] 

- [u]The A.I should react to the trap you put on the floor more often[/u] ... come on, did he really didnt see that huge ass trap my in front of him? 
 
- [u]Hard to find players on multiplayer of for co-op[/u]. Alrought the co-op is not a problem if you own the game i saw that no so many people play mutiplayer being hard to find a good server and is very rare to find a full one altought this may or not be a problem depending where you live is something to keep note of.

- [u]Not having a minimap is hard to get used to [/u]. I understand that hardcore is supposed to be HARD like that the point but i found not having a minimap  and the game not showing me where i have to go infuriating  since the map pretty big and this lead to me walking past objectives and wandering the map  aimlessly, killing everyone and hoping that i would stumble upon the main thing i had to do. I got better at this at time when on but for me at least it was a pretty steep learning curve 

- [u]The locked weapons  behind DLC.[/u] It sucks and it shouldnt be a thing. The game full price is about 60 dollars/euro why do 50% of the guns be looked behind a DLC? is infuriating.
 
- [u] Melee kills are too easy to get. [/u] In campain this isnt a huge problem but is still pretty wierd  how you can scare them when running up to them if they are not aware of your presence locking them in to an animation allowing you to get easy kills.  in multiplayer however... things change and is still  very easy to get melee kills by camping in a bush scanning for movement and then running up to you and killing you leaving very little time for you to react and giving you PTSD thinking that   someone is watching  always you  and shooting every bush  like we are in vietnam.


[h1] The  conclusion  [/h1] 

The game has it flaws some flaws? yes, many that i didnt talk about because i didnt want to make this book of a review any longer than it is  but is a good game and you should give it a chance although i would recommend getting it on a sale with the DLC's being around 10 euros and honestly i think is worth it.

I think it's appropriate time to contribute my review to the community,

i finished the entire campaign including all DLCs on Sniper Elite difficulty, and also i spend around 10-15 hours on survival mode (both solo and tag team with other players) 

well if you play this series before i believe i don't have anything much to say, because the gameplay still satisfied as the predecessor, plus more gorgeous graphic and if you buy this during 75-85% discount for deluxe edition, there is nothing to complain, 

but for those whose never play this series before, this is a "major" stealth game mechanics, but if you want to be a Rambo, sure you can do that too, but from my experience that i try both way, i feel stealth is the way developer would like us to play, because it's really fun, for the story this one took place in Italy during world war II, it's fictional combined with base on true (event, character) and by the way, don't let the name of the game fool you, there is plenty of firearms for you to play, not just sniper rifle, depending on your style like i said, so if you are looking for TPS with great quality of game, wait for sale (Winter Sale about to come after all) and grab this one you won't regret, oh but don't forget everything inside this game is "At the world war II Era"

That's it for this game from my perspective (actually there is several multiplayer modes, but less people still playing them, but if you patient enough to wait then maybe some few people will join you, or if you want to play Survival, please just add me, i still craving to kill Fascist and Nazi though)

It's a genuinely okay shooter game, but the controls could be a bit clunky and unlike Call of Duty or Battlefield anything, there seems to be no way to heal oneself or automatically magically get healed with first aid kits. It works great for the detailed graphic display of sniper rifle bullets penetrating Nazi German enemy soldier's body parts and organs.

Despite a lot of content being locked behind DLC, there's quite a ton of things to do. 
You can run the campaign on as many difficulties as you please.
You can play the game however you want to. 
Do you to play like a sniper? You can.
Do you ant to play stealthy? You can.
Do you want to play like a fucking braindead ape with an smg rushing your enemies? You bet you can.
I'll say this though. Start buying DLCs once you're certain you want to put in more time in this game.

So yeah, I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who likes to do some sniping.

This game has potential but need many polishing and improvements.

Positive:
1. Gameplay is somewhat decent and simulates sniping atmosphere pretty good, the X-ray after effect is a nice addition although too many is sickening so I minimize it.
2. The main character voice acting suits this game.

Negative:
1. Overall graphic is a bit below mediocre, in general view graphic is mediocre but graphic for far distance place is bad (the first map, San Celini Island is very obvious for sea outside of main island).

2. Little buggy, I encounter 2x crash during loading and 1x funny bug, mc died immediately after talking to Kessler in interrogation. I cant reproduce them again.

3. Enemy often has sixth sense, first is when I look at soldiers from far away with binoculars, enemy soldiers just act casually without suspect but when I look with rifle scope wanting to snipe him, enemy somehow often acts a bit evasive. Second when I did some legit stealth kill (did it from behind without victim suspecting and other enemies are not closed by), other enemies are often alerted. Both happen in peaceful, not alert mode.

4. Common weapons. I can understand developer charging us for extra missions and special weapons, but I cannot accept developer charging more for common weapon in WW2 such as grease gun, sten gun. Please dont be too greedy.

Absolutely fun to cyber bully the shit out of nazi Germany with those manual saves, even better if you buy the hitler DLC and shoot him in the testies

[THINGS I LIKED]

1. Nicely made game. I think this is the best sniping experience that you can get as of date.
2. Wide range of sniping rifles with lots of mastering to do
3. Well thought of scenarios
4. You can play this game like a real sniper or go for ALL BANG!
5. The videos of bullets cracking through skull or testicles is interesting to watch but may get boring after some time. I have it switched off in my settings. I play lot of multiplayer and do not want that interfering with the gameplay.
6. I really liked the ghillie suit (Part of DLC). That really helps me be a part of the foliage and knife an unsuspecting enemy. More fun to use it in multiplayer games.
7. The multiplayer game offers you 10 base maps which can be tweaked to play different scenarios for example Death Match, Team Death Match, Capture the Flag etc.
8. I loved the Authentic Plus Mode (With Bullet Drop and Wind). Once you get used to this, you may not like playing any other mode.

[THINGS I DID NOT LIKE]

1. The Game has lot of bugs/glitches. This becomes a PITA especially in the multiplayer when people take advantage of it.
2. The ability to shoot long distances without aiming. One may argue that they do aim but right clicking to briefly open the scope and then left clicking to shoot is not aiming. You cannot do that in real life.
3. The ability to spin and shoot. This is really stupid. Again, something which you cannot do in real life.
4. Spawn Points. Your teammate can block a spawn point. Because of this your entire team spawns at that same place. Then it is like shooting ducks in a barrel.
5. There have been no recent updates. It becomes boring playing same map again and again after some time.

[WOULD LOVE TO HAVE THE BELOW]

1. More multiplayer maps. It becomes quite boring to play the same map again and again for so many years

[SUGGESTION]

1. Do not buy this game at full price. Not worth it. Wait for the sale and then buy. And during the sale get all the DLC. It is really worth it!
2. Play the campaign map first before playing multiplayer. Get used to your rifle and the gameplay first else you will get lost in multiplayer and finally may give up the game in frustration.
3. Please do not blindly follow the Youtube videos. The most common mistake that newbies do is go to places shown in those videos and get killed by pros.
4. Have an open Steam Profile (Especially the gaming hours). Ensure you do not have VAC/Game Bans. Else you will not be able to play in most of the servers.

I gotta say, Sniper Elite 4 really surprised me with it's amazing value. I don't know if it's because this is my first Sniper Elite game, but this is an experience that really gives you the true sense that you are an elite Sniper. I put 48 hours into Sniper Elite 4 at the time this review was written and I'm going to try to explain why I enjoyed the game so much in great detail, and pointing out some of it's faults. Alright, let's get started.


[h1]Story and Campaign[/h1]


Set behind enemy lines in fascist Italy before Operation Avalanche, 1943. You are Karl Fairburne, a British Commando who is seemingly a one-man army. The Germans have created some kind of new 'Wonder Weapon' capable of destroying naval vessels with deadly accuracy, and It's your job to find out how to stop it and ultimately loosen Nazi Germany's grip on Italy.
Avoiding spoilers for any new player for this game, that's about it story wise. As for the main characters, they appear as wood, who seem incapable of changing their facial expression, even the character you play as- don't tell me you really like Karl. And I get that he's a commando and all, but it's hard to really give a damn about the cast when you're making fun of them like I and my friends were. Hell, they even give you the option to play as a different character after you beat a mission for the first time, but you'll still have Karl's commentary going in the background. I can give credit to the game for making me laugh though.


[h1]Gameplay and Coop[/h1]


First, graphically speaking, Sniper Elite 4 looks absolutely beautiful on max settings; The payout for the specs is totally worth it. I gotta tell you, the mission design is amazing, the levels are huge, average around 40 minutes to complete, and you can play through it any way you want to. Grab a friend and play coop campaign; it's so much fun. 
The progression for weapons in Sniper Elite 4 is unique and creative. Instead of getting generic kills to progress weapon unlocks, you must complete a series of challenges for said weapon for damage, reduced kick, etc. The Stealth in this game is done very well compared to many I've played, though the A.I can be a little silly at times.

[h1]Rating[/h1]

My final rating for Rebellion's Sniper Elite 4 is a strong 8/10. If you want it, I recommend purchasing the Sniper Elite 4 Deluxe Edition. On sale of course. The extra content with it will add much more to your experience with all DLC including another campaign.

I hope my review helped you out.

I'm playing on the hardest difficulty (Authentic+) and I'm enjoying it. 

First thing's first: The sniping is fun. it's challenging and it takes some time on the range to figure out how to aim, but there are some basic rules you can learn that will help you. And the kill cams are extremely satisfying. There's a reason it's what this game series is known for. 

So far I've only played the first 3 levels but I have to say I'm extremely impressed with the level design, especially on the first two. There is a LOT of freedom in terms of which way you go and there is a lot to explore and discover.

Stealth in this game is pretty good, the noise you make matters and there are environmental factors you can use to help keep yourself unseen from an audio perspective (e.g. masking the sound of your rifle by timing your shots to be disguised by an environmental ambient noise). Also when the soldiers are looking for you they do a good job of actually searching every location so you do have to be careful.

Once the AI finds you they do a pretty good job of attacking you. I'd say there may be some scenarios where maybe the AI could be better (e.g. in the first mission I believe that at the very least the big general you're trying to kill should be barricading himself in a room or something or trying to escape once it's known that your an enemy trying to kill him, not actively searching for you himself). But overall they are smart enough to kill you and able to be manipulated in a pretty consistent way, which is a must in a stealth game.

Also, these levels are LONG. Like 1-2 hours per level with a lot of stuff to do in each, on top of just killing nazis. you can find letters/documents that can give you hints about objectives and do a good job world building. Overall they are very well done.

I'm gonna give this game an 8/10. It's solid fun, and with the dlc there is a lot of content and a lot of nazi's to kill. Also you can shoot Hitler's right nut off. What's there not to like?

This is one of the greatest sniper games, if not the greatest.  Purely for its authentic plus difficulty.  I'm not usually a masochist but this game knows just how to make combat enjoyable. I finished the all the main campaigns and some DLCs in Cadet level and some in Normal, so I dont have the full mechanic experience of this game yet. But I like it a lot. Killing nazi soldiers is never gonna be enough in any games, but this one satisfy my needs to do hundreds of  head shots or long-range sniping.  And even though I've only been playing the easy level, it's not easy-easy. Bullets and explosives are a lot to be found in this level, but not the silent ones, so I'm still forced to do stealthy strategies. The x-ray cameras can be set as off, but even that I set it on, it's not too regular that it annoys me. Besides, watching ruptured organs and testicles for killshot never gets old. But of course the A.I in this level are not that smart, as to be expected. 

For completionist, this game offer some collectibles like documents and letters for each levels. Too bad the bug is a biatch because I've lost a lot of them when the people that are holding on to them disappeared after I killed them 

I can imagine it's going to be quite tough for the "authentic" level and it's going to be more fun. If you have the sniper patience, this game is totally for you. The replay values is also great

After years of playing Call of Duty, this is a whole new world. While Karl as a protagonist is a little over-dramatically presented, the game play is phenomenal. The world is much more open with multiple ways to accomplish many tasks and varied approaches and strategies can be applied to each level. There are five levels of difficulty - I am playing through on level 3 now and I'm still finding new options and locations I haven't seen before. For me this game hits that narrow sweet spot of being too challenging to be boring and not so difficult that it becomes frustrating. Well worth the money!

A surprisingly hardcore stealth experience, especially on the highest difficulty.
Authentic plus will tingle your perfectionism, one error can spell disaster and sometimes the perfect run hinges on that one shot.

On top of being an amazing stealth game it functions surprisingly well as a standard action-shooter, which the game will inevitably devolve into on your first mission attempts.
